p: The suspension was then filtered and washed with 300 mL HCl (3.7 wt.%) to remove metal ions. The obtained slurry was rinsed with deionized water to remove the residual acids. The slurry was redispersed in 500 mL of deionized water and further dialyzed against ultrapure water using a membrane tubing of MWCO of 8000–14,000 mol g −1 for two weeks until the ionic conductivity of the dialysis water was below 5 μS cm −1. The obtained GO aqueous dispersion was repeatedly centrifuged at 2000 r.p.m. for 20 min to remove non-exfoliated graphite particles, and then centrifuged at 10,000 rpm for 40 min to yield the GO stock suspension.
